name: secretgeek
text:
@roytang cheers for the responses. I generally agree — though I think there is a lot of sneaky anti-competitive (or straight up monopolist) behavior that goes unnoticed, which indicates that these “natural monopolies” are not so natural.

I think point 2, government intervention is where the opportunities have been missed. Requiring open protocols, shared, non proprietary standards, not closed silos. Goes a long way toward preventing the harms of these kinds of market dominance.
